medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presented at the age of 1 year with recurrent, often asymptomatic episodes of bacteremia caused by group D Salmonella species over a period of 18 months. Symptoms included irritability, swelling of both legs, and leg pain. Episodes of bacteremia were recurrent despite treatment.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient had one episode of benign Kingella kingae bacteremia at age 3 months and one episode of epididymitis caused by Streptococcus pneumoniae serotype 9a at age 4 months, both of which responded well to antibiotic treatment. No mycobacterial disease or other unusual infections were present.
medical_history.family_history: The patient was born to young and healthy parents who are first cousins. His 3 siblings are healthy.
medical_history.social_history: The patient received all scheduled vaccinations on time, except for BCG.
